body:
I changed this:
https://github.com/HunterMcGushion/hyperparameter_hunter/blob/master/hyperparameter_hunter/models.py#L156

to look like this:
```python
        if "silent" in expected_fit_parameters and 'verbose' not in fit_kwargs:
            fit_kwargs["silent"] = True
```
but I'm not sure if it won't break down other models behaviour.

issue.title: Use only one of 'verbose' and 'silent' parameters to model.

No, that's perfectly OK. Thanks for quick merges!

issue.title: Using holdout set results in ValueError.

repository.name: hyperparameter_hunter
repository.description: Easy hyperparameter optimization and automatic result saving across machine learning algorithms and libraries

issue.body:
Trying to use holdout set. Following snippet results in `ValueError: The truth value of a DataFrame is ambiguous. Use a.empty, a.bool(), a.item(), a.any() or a.all().`

```python
from hyperparameter_hunter import Environment, CrossValidationExperiment, BayesianOptimization, Integer
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd

X = np.random.random((100, 10))
df = pd.DataFrame(data=X)
env = Environment(
    train_dataset=df,
    holdout_dataset=df,
    test_dataset=df,
    root_results_path='HyperparameterHunterAssets',
    metrics_map=['roc_auc_score'],
    cross_validation_type='StratifiedKFold',
    cross_validation_params=dict(n_splits=5, shuffle=True, random_state=32),
)
```

body: This is closed by 824024ffa049b144d8118c5ba2c544870be9e026 (PR #84). @alaneckhardt, if you disagree, feel free to let me know, and we can reopen this! Thank you for your contributions!
